item.description:
This is another of our bimonthly seminars on Introduction to Bicycle Commuting, taught by experienced members of the Portland Bicycle Commuting Meetup. A variety of general topics will be covered, such as bike requirements, carrying stuff, logistics, and a bit about Traffic Safety. (Traffic Safety will be covered in more detail in its own seminar next month.)

This month's seminar will be taught by Bill Ridlon, who has been bike commuting sporadically for almost 40 years. He currently utilizes a combination of driving, bicycling, and busing to accomplish his 25-mile round trip between Arundel and Portland.

For more online information about beginning bike commuting, see


Our Getting Started page

Our Carrying Things by Bike page

Our Bike Trails and Maps page

Our PowerPoint presentation on the topic
item.why: Learn some basics and meet some kindred spirits.
item.name: Introduction to Bicycle Commuting
